name: gitblame
description: See git blame information in the status bar.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Git Blame (extension) executes command line tools in the workspace

commands.title: Git Blame: View last change online
Git Blame: Copy hash to clipboard
Git Blame: Copy tool URL to clipboard
Git Blame: Git show for current line hash

colors.description: Inline git blame message. Defaults to editorCodeLens.foreground

enumDescriptions: Show a info message with a short summary of the commit
Attempt to directly open the tool URL
Run git show in a vscode terminal view
Copies the hash of the current line's commit to the clipboard

gitblame.statusBarPositionPriority.description: Priority where the status bar view should be placed

gitblame.inlineMessageEnabled.description: Show blame information inline (next to the code)

gitblame.inlineMessageMargin.description: The amount of margin between line and inline blame view

gitblame.currentUserAlias.markdownDescription: Replaces `${author.name}` and `${committer.name}` when the git config `user.email` matches the author's or committer's email address.

gitblame.remoteName.description: The name of the git remote used to build the URL.

gitblame.commitUrl.markdownDescription: The link to an online tool to view a commit (use `${hash}` for the commit hash).

gitblame.ignoreWhitespace.markdownDescription: Ignore whitespace changes when blaming (`-w` flag)

gitblame.isWebPathPlural.deprecationMessage: This setting has been replaced by gitblame.pluralWebPathSubstrings

gitblame.pluralWebPathSubstrings.markdownDescription: An array of substrings that, when present in the git origin URL, adds an extra _s_ to the url after _commit_ in `gitblame.commitUrl`'s default behavior

gitblame.delayBlame.description: This setting adds a delay (in milliseconds) before the blame is displayed

gitblame.parallelBlames.description: Limit allowed parallel git blame process count

gitblame.maxLineCount.markdownDescription: Will skip blaming files with **more** lines than this value

gitblame.revsFile.markdownDescription: List of refs-file names to look for relative to the closest `.git`-folder. The first file in the list that is accessible will be used with the `-S`-argument in `git blame`.
